imdb.title: Mejaa
imdb.plot: Honda Goro the son of a famous baseball player loves nothing more than baseball itself. His biggest dream is to show his father that he can become the best pitcher in the world despite all the hardships he had to endure he keeps o...

episodes.title: Message
episodes.plot: After a stellar run in the Majors, an injured Goro loses his spot with the Hornets. Returning to Japan, he quietly commits to training for a comeback.

episodes.title: World Series 1
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: World Series 2
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: Super Rookie
episodes.plot: With the Major League season approaching, Goro arrives in Florida for training camp. To his annoyance, he is quickly surrounded by Japanese media.

episodes.title: A Prominent Debut!
episodes.plot: Goro is named the Hornets' starting pitcher for the third game of the season. He gets off to a great start as his family and friends watch from Japan.

episodes.title: In an Impossible Dilemma
episodes.plot: Goro seems back in form as his second start approaches. Meanwhile, Hornets' closer Watts has a theory to explain Goro's peculiar Major League debut.

episodes.title: The Southpaw in Distress
episodes.plot: After hitting a batter in the head with a pitch, Goro is in shock. His struggles persist in the following game, forcing the coach to make a decision.

episodes.title: The Fruits of the Treatment
episodes.plot: Goro wakes up in the house of sports psychologist Billy Oliver. He begins Goro's treatment by having him watch a DVD of his past pitching failures.

episodes.title: What it Takes to be a Pro
episodes.plot: After giving up a hit to Silva, Goro is able to calm himself down and close out the inning. But his lack of emotion puzzles him after the game.

episodes.title: Rookies' Troubles
episodes.plot: Goro has recovered from the yips, but his lack of passion for the game is preventing a full return to form. Meanwhile, Gibson Jr.'s slump continues.

episodes.title: An Electrifying Return
episodes.plot: Goro and Gibson Jr. are both shocked by Gibson's announcement that he is coming out of retirement. The veteran's first game back is against Goro.

episodes.title: Fully Back on the Mound
episodes.plot: Still intent on returning to the Major League, Gibson drops down to the minors. Oliver reveals to Goro the reason why Gibson continues to pitch.

episodes.title: Each Person's Summer
episodes.plot: Shimizu focuses on saving up money to visit Goro in America. She considers quitting softball when her work and practice become difficult to balance.

episodes.title: The Entrusted Dream
episodes.plot: With Goro fully recovered, the Hornets finally attain a winning record. However, a rare batting slump from Dunston snaps the team's winning streak.

episodes.title: The Unspoken Rule
episodes.plot: The Hornets are nearing the top of the division, but things go awry when the owner trades for Mike Murdoch, a player known for causing team friction.

episodes.title: A Chain of Negativity
episodes.plot: The Hornets' owner blames Murdoch for the losing streak and demands that he be benched. But Coach Stacy offers the powerful batter a second chance.

episodes.title: Ace's Responsibility
episodes.plot: The game against the Panthers continues. Goro's inspired pitching amid the team's uneven play finally triggers a change of attitude in Murdoch.

episodes.title: Weak Point
episodes.plot: The Hornets' next game is against Goro's former team, the Salmons. Goro tries greeting them before the game, but they give him the cold shoulder.

episodes.title: A Resolute Will
episodes.plot: The inconsistent Hornets are back to their losing ways. Goro starts against the Browns, but he's quickly frustrated by an unusually strict umpire.

episodes.title: Unexpected Guest
episodes.plot: When Goro bluntly refuses the Hornets' owner's request to star in a T.V. commercial, a fellow employee named Sophia is tasked with changing his mind.

episodes.title: Different?!
episodes.plot: With the roster set to be expanded with players from the minors, Roy is motivated when he hears of his old teammate Kellogg's success with the Bats.

episodes.title: Creeping Shadow
episodes.plot: Gibson and Gibson Jr. face off in the majors for the first time. Afterward, the Hornets play the first of a three-game series against the Coyotes.

episodes.title: That Dream
episodes.plot: Goro is named the closer for the Hornets. He sees a doctor after experiencing pain in his left arm during the Coyotes game and receives some bad news.

episodes.title: Never Give Up!
episodes.plot: The Hornets and the Coyotes play one final game for the division championship. Silva gets the Coyotes going with a home run in the sixth inning.

episodes.title: Remaining Opportunity
episodes.plot: Goro takes the mound against the Coyotes but struggles due to a lack of practice. He soon finds himself in a pinch with the bases loaded and no outs.

episodes.title: Beyond Capability
episodes.plot: The championship-deciding match enters extra innings. Despite the risk to his arm, Goro carries the Hornets with a brilliant pitching display.

episodes.title: Tenacity to Glory
episodes.plot: Goro is discharged from the hospital, and Sophia is tasked with handling his rehab. Gibson and Gibson Jr. compete for a chance at the World Series.

episodes.title: To the Future
episodes.plot: The team allows Goro to continue his rehab in Japan. Shimizu goes to see him, but she has a misunderstanding about his relationship with Sophia.

episodes.title: Once More
episodes.plot: Shimizu tries to find Goro after hearing he's returned from Japan. Toshiya tells Goro about the Baseball World Cup being held in America next spring.

episodes.title: Feelings Different between the Two
episodes.plot: Shimizu is furious with Goro for standing her up. After talking to Taiga at Seishu High the next day, Goro realizes that Shimizu has feelings for him.

episodes.title: Representative Close!
episodes.plot: Goro is fired up about his plan to make it onto Japan's national baseball team. Shimizu drops by Goro's house after having trouble contacting him.

episodes.title: Trial and Error
episodes.plot: Goro feels the need to improve his curve-ball after Kyoshiro easily sends it flying, but has difficulty doing so. He then receives advice from Nemoto.

episodes.title: Young Japan
episodes.plot: The practice game between the national and youth teams begins. Coach Sasaki announces that the winner will represent Japan in the Baseball World Cup.

episodes.title: Unselfish Fastball
episodes.plot: Goro and Toshiya grow frustrated with each other during the practice game. Hoping to restore the chemistry between them, Yakushiji speaks to Toshiya.

episodes.title: Sudden Notification
episodes.plot: Shimizu travels to Florida alone to support Goro as he tries to make the majors. On her way to meet him, however, her rental car breaks down.

episodes.title: Everyone's Respective Expectations
episodes.plot: The second round of the Baseball World Cup begins in Los Angeles. Meanwhile, news of Goro's selection for the national team causes a stir back home.

episodes.title: Pressure and Real Worth
episodes.plot: Fuming after his encounter with Silva at the airport, Goro is determined to show the Venezuelan shortstop what Japanese baseball is all about.

episodes.title: Polished Fangs
episodes.plot: Goro takes the mound against Venezuela in the bottom of the sixth inning. Toshiya's lack of focus quickly leads to Japan giving up a double steal.

episodes.title: Not a Man!!
episodes.plot: Tendo criticizes the coaching staff after the game for not using him as the closer against Venezuela. Japan takes on its next opponent: South Korea.

episodes.title: The Curse
episodes.plot: Japan faces elimination if it loses to the Dominican Republic, but due to a certain rule, Goro is unable to pitch. Shimizu meets a Japanese girl.

episodes.title: Japanese Baseball
episodes.plot: The game against the Dominican Republic enters its final innings. Japan escapes a dangerous pinch with Mayumura on the mound but still needs to score.

episodes.title: I'm Alright!
episodes.plot: Miho confesses her true identity to Shimizu and the real reason she came to America. Meanwhile, Goro meets Momoko and Shingo at the airport.

episodes.title: Aggressive Baseball
episodes.plot: Japan faces Cuba in the knockout stage and is quickly put to the test by its opponent's various curve-balls. Goro spots a familiar face in the crowd.

episodes.title: Everyone's Resolution
episodes.plot: Gibson Jr. tries to prevent his father from playing because of his health condition. Despite the risk to his life, Gibson remains determined to pitch.

episodes.title: America's Pride
episodes.plot: Gibson insists on taking the mound when America falls in danger of losing to Venezuela. Aware of his condition, America's coach is hesitant to oblige.

episodes.title: Towards the Promised Place
episodes.plot: Goro rushes to the hospital upon hearing of Gibson's accident after the game against Venezuela. Gibson reveals why he continues to pitch.

episodes.title: Pitching's Origin
episodes.plot: The Baseball World Cup final begins. Mayumura is named the starting pitcher for Japan, but he has a surprising revelation for Goro before the game.

episodes.title: With Chest of Pride
episodes.plot: Gibson slips out of the hospital to support his team in person. Inspired by his sudden presence, America begins playing to its full potential.

episodes.title: For Oneself's Sake
episodes.plot: Despondent after his pitches are hit by consecutive batters, Goro is soon re-energized by his teammates. The game enters the top of the ninth inning.

episodes.title: The Neverending Dream
episodes.plot: Gibson takes the mound for America. Finally able to achieve his dream, Goro goes all out as he and Gibson give the crowd a spectacular pitcher's duel.

episodes.title: Father's Back
episodes.plot: Now in the 16th inning, Japan has a chance to win with a runner on third base. Toshiya attempts to take Gibson by surprise with a risky play.

episodes.title: End of the Struggle
episodes.plot: The tournament reaches its epic conclusion. After the game, Goro visits the hospital to check on Gibson's status, and Toshiya reunites with Miho.

episodes.title: The Road to Tomorrow
episodes.plot: A dejected Goro considers quitting baseball now that he will never be able to face Gibson again. Taken aback, Shimizu is unsure of what to do.

episodes.title: To the Birthplace of Baseball
episodes.plot: Goro's luggage is stolen at the airport in Los Angeles. He then receives help from Hayato, a Japanese citizen also trying out for the major leagues.

episodes.title: Tryout
episodes.plot: Goro and Hayato both pass the first test at tryouts. For the second test, the rookies must stage a come-from-behind victory against a Single-A team.

episodes.title: I'll Do It
episodes.plot: Hayato's hit leads to two runs, but Nick's selfish play puts the team's comeback effort in jeopardy. A blister causes Goro to struggle with pitching.

episodes.title: This is the Majors!
episodes.plot: Goro is given a chance at a roster spot in the majors with the Salmons. He quickly gets into a scuffle during practice with the Salmons' ace pitcher.

episodes.title: Sign towards the World
episodes.plot: After realizing how much he needs to improve,Goro gets off to a strong start pitching in his first major league exhibition game.

episodes.title: Unforgivable!!
episodes.plot: In his first Triple-A game, Goro throws off the Falcons with his new curve-ball, but it doesn't work for long. He then faces an unexpected opponent.

episodes.title: Courage, full score!
episodes.plot: Goro tries out for the Memphis Bats after being released by the Cougars. He runs into a Japanese girl at the airport, and his luggage is stolen again.

episodes.title: Debut!
episodes.plot: Alice convinces Goro to serve as the Bats' closer. In Japan, the number one draft pick Toshiya Sato draws attention in the Warriors' game.

episodes.title: Challenger
episodes.plot: Toshiya's confidence suffers an unexpected blow during the game, but his coach still decides to start him in the exhibition match.

episodes.title: It's not impossible
episodes.plot: Goro is adapting to life in America. Meanwhile in Japan, the Seishu High graduates reflect on their time spent with Goro and take their next steps.

episodes.title: Try and aim for it
episodes.plot: The Bats start the season with the worst record in the division. Moved by Sanders' desire to win a championship, Goro tries motivating his teammates.

episodes.title: Liar!
episodes.plot: The Bats rise to second in the division. Now playing baseball in college, Komori serves as a substitute coach for a Little League team.

episodes.title: A Stupid Bet
episodes.plot: Goro racks up 19 saves as the Bats rise to the top of their division. The team gets a new player, and the coach demotes Sanders to the bench.

episodes.title: Keene's Past
episodes.plot: The Bats are winning, but Goro is unsatisfied with Keene's style of play. Alice explains Keene's behavior by talking about an event in his past.

episodes.title: Hero
episodes.plot: Sanders replaces Keene in the starting lineup for the first time in a while, but his rusty play results in snapping the Bats' winning streak.

episodes.title: I'm fed up!
episodes.plot: The summer high school baseball tournament has begun. Now captain of Seishu High, Taiga is annoyed by the behavior of his team during training.

episodes.title: Where to Aim
episodes.plot: Goro and the Bats hit a rough patch, so his teammates invite him on a drive to cheer him up. Shimizu's friends try jump-starting her love life.

episodes.title: Alice's Dream, Everyone's Dream
episodes.plot: Alice visits her grandfather in hospital. He seems healthy, but his condition suddenly turns serious after the Bats suffer a humiliating home loss.

episodes.title: Responsibility
episodes.plot: After the Bats make the playoffs, six players including Goro and Keene are called up to the majors. Goro has mixed feelings about his promotion.

episodes.title: Get out!
episodes.plot: The Bats win their series against the Sharks to advance to the finals, where they will face the Falcons -- and the indomitable Gibson Jr.

episodes.title: Trouble from the Start
episodes.plot: The first game of the finals begins. Driven by their bet, Goro and Gibson Jr. both give it their all. The Bats fall behind in the first inning.

episodes.title: The Single Ball of Fate
episodes.plot: Goro's hand injury causes him to lose control over his pitching. After he unintentionally walks consecutive batters, Gibson Jr. steps up to the plate.

episodes.title: One More Deciding Match
episodes.plot: Star rookies Toshiya and Mayumura face off in the finals in Japan. Toshiya is in low spirits after his team suffers consecutive losses.

episodes.title: A Great Man
episodes.plot: Gibson Jr.'s unfinished business with Goro causes him to struggle in the majors -- until he sees the news that Goro has returned from injury.

episodes.title: A Truly Worthy Rival
episodes.plot: In the championship-deciding game, Goro gets a chance at bat with a runner on base. To his disappointment, he is told to make a sacrificial bunt.

episodes.title: An Oath
episodes.plot: The final game goes to extra innings. In the bottom of the 10th inning, Goro and Gibson Jr. have one last showdown to decide the champion.

episodes.title: Start from Zero
episodes.plot: Goro leaves Kaido High and considers transferring to Mifune High, but he reconsiders after watching Mifune dominate a preliminary match.

episodes.title: New Friends
episodes.plot: Goro tries to form a baseball team at Seishu High, but gets a cold response from the other boys. He receives support from a girl named Nakamura.

episodes.title: From Father to Son
episodes.plot: A losing streak has Shigeno in bad spirits. The school chairperson tells Goro that she can't approve of a team until he has teacher supervision.

episodes.title: Reckless Gamble
episodes.plot: Baseball club supervisor Yamada nets a practice match with Teijin High. Goro leads the team with his fast pitching but things take an unexpected turn.

episodes.title: Our Grounds
episodes.plot: Seishu ties the game with Fujii's hit, but Tashiro is still not satisfied. Goro speaks honestly after Yamada asks him why he's taking such a gamble.

episodes.title: Their Respective Choices
episodes.plot: Goro's team begins training. Shigeno shows up as a temporary coach but an intentionally harsh practice session causes most of the team to quit.

episodes.title: Unexpected Visitor
episodes.plot: Under Shigeno's coaching, the team begins training in earnest with the goal of winning a preliminary game by spring. A new guy shows up at practice.

episodes.title: Egashira's Plot
episodes.plot: Seishu plays a practice match against Kaido's reserve team. They struggle with the opposing pitcher and fall behind thanks to some poor fielding.

episodes.title: Absent Ace
episodes.plot: Goro is dejected when he hears it will take three months to recover from his injury. Kaido High's chief manager Egashira visits him in the hospital.

episodes.title: Contagious Fighting Spirit
episodes.plot: The team is excited to play Yoka High in the first round of the tournament. Looking healthy, Goro throws a perfect fastball in practice.

episodes.title: Wounded Ace
episodes.plot: After a fierce seventh-inning comeback, Seishu trails by just three points. Despite his injury, Goro takes the mound in place of an unmotivated Taiga.

episodes.title: Battle Against Mifune, Start!
episodes.plot: The doctor tells Goro that his career is in jeopardy if he keeps playing hurt. Goro appears to take his advice but secretly looks for other options.

episodes.title: Climax! Mifune Battle
episodes.plot: Seishu faces Mifune High in the second round. Taiga loses his focus as Mifune breaks the deadlock to take the lead in the bottom of the fourth inning.

episodes.title: Willpower vs Willpower
episodes.plot: Mifune has no outs and a batter on second base in the bottom of the sixth inning. Thrown by Mifune's unexpected tactics, Seishu falls further behind.

episodes.title: Full Swing
episodes.plot: Goro takes the mound in place of Taiga with two outs and the bases loaded. Komori is flustered by Goro's fastball, which looks to be at full strength.

episodes.title: Unexpected Reunion
episodes.plot: After pitching a no-hitter in the third game, Goro catches the attention of Yokohama Blue Oceans scout Katsuragi, who proposes the team draft him.

episodes.title: Pitching Battle!
episodes.plot: Scouting the competition, Goro is taken aback by the improvement of their next opponent, Kuriyama High. Later, he runs into Katori before the game.

episodes.title: Last Spurt!
episodes.plot: The game with Kuriyama High nears its end. Karasawa hits a two-run homer to take the lead and Katori corners Seishu with two outs in the ninth inning.

episodes.title: Challenge to the Top
episodes.plot: Tashiro pushes the team hard during training ahead of its match against Kaido. Goro objects when the doctor tells him he can't practice for the game.

episodes.title: Chance! Manual Baseball
episodes.plot: When Goro underestimates the opposing pitcher Ichihara, Seishu's hopes of taking an early lead are pinned on their only remaining batter, Tashiro.

episodes.title: Toshiya's Secret Plan
episodes.plot: Goro gives up his first hit during the bottom of a rainy third inning. He quickly makes up for his error by using a trick play to eliminate Kusano.

episodes.title: Head to Head Battle
episodes.plot: Ichihara is flustered after giving up hits to both Taiga and Uchiyama. But his pitching only gets worse when Tashiro steps up to bat.

episodes.title: A Close Fight
episodes.plot: Kaido buckles under Goro's all-out attack. All signs point to a pitcher's game, but Seishu's defense begins to struggle in the seventh inning.

episodes.title: The End of the Strategy
episodes.plot: After Taiga's batting pulls Seishu ahead, Kaido finally sends in their ace pitcher Mayumura. Goro is soon caught off guard by Mayumura's fastball.

episodes.title: Ace Full of Injuries
episodes.plot: The game enters extra innings, but Goro's right ankle is reaching its limit. When Tashiro says they should forfeit, Goro speaks from the heart.

episodes.title: Towards Your Dreams
episodes.plot: Goro watches from home as Kaido wins at Koshien. Later, he spends valuable time with his friends at a summer festival after being invited by Tashiro.

episodes.title: He Returns...
episodes.plot: Goro moves back to Mifune. Komori is glad to have the chance to play baseball with him again, only for Goro to reveal he now plays soccer.

episodes.title: There is one dream!
episodes.plot: The delinquents have left the baseball team, but none of the former members return. Goro's words inspire Komori and Obayashi to recruit new members.

episodes.title: The Baseball Club Starts!
episodes.plot: Goro's story inspires the delinquents to get serious about baseball again. Goro goes to see the reborn Mifune East Junior High baseball team play.

episodes.title: Rivals Reunite
episodes.plot: Goro joins the baseball team. To gear up for the summer tournament, he seeks a game against Tomonoura Junior High, where he meets his old pal Toshiya.

episodes.title: Toshiya's Past
episodes.plot: Mifune East falls behind in round one of the tournament because Goro shows up late, but his off-speed pitches gets hitters out in fine fashion.

episodes.title: The Recruiter's Conspiracy
episodes.plot: Mifune East faces Seibukan in round two. Goro has a perfect game going through 4 2/3 innings, enthralling a high school scout in the crowd.

episodes.title: Powerful Rival! Tomonoura
episodes.plot: Toshiya, Tomonoura's captain, proposes a bet to Goro that raises the stakes for their teams' showdown, but Goro gets goaded into a rash of mistakes.

episodes.title: ...For What Reason?
episodes.plot: Goro and Yamane hit back-to-back home runs, rattling Toshiya. Seeing his teammates band together, Toshiya realizes he'd forgotten the joy of baseball.

episodes.title: The End of the Battle
episodes.plot: Toshiya takes the mound and freezes Miyamoto with his fastball. After encouragement from Goro, Miyamoto swings the bat, with unexpected results.

episodes.title: A Fresh Resolve
episodes.plot: Goro is set on getting into Kaido High's baseball club with Toshiya after their junior high affiliate crushes him. The Mifune East boys hit the beach.

episodes.title: The Narrow Gate to Kaido
episodes.plot: Goro, Toshiya and Komori all pass the first two stages of Kaido High's harsh skills test, but Toshiya and Komori are then pitted against each other.

episodes.title: The Ticket to Kaido
episodes.plot: The skills test ends with a five-on-five tournament. Goro is happy to be on Toshiya's team, but is looked down upon for coming from an obscure school.

episodes.title: See Ya...
episodes.plot: Goro and Toshiya pass the skills test and must now take an academic exam. But Goro isn't used to studying, and he ends up being late to the exam.

episodes.title: The Island of Dreams
episodes.plot: Goro and Toshiya get into Kaido High and proudly join the baseball club. They go to a school facility on a small island for six months hard training.

episodes.title: The Requirements of a Pitcher
episodes.plot: After three months at the training facility, Goro has grown strong. The coaches announce an aptitude test to determine the players' positions.

episodes.title: A Genuine Baseball Kid
episodes.plot: In a final exam to decide who will leave the island to join the second team, Goro is as free-spirited as ever. Onuki, who had quit the team, shows up.

episodes.title: Fleeting Summer Break
episodes.plot: Coach Suo declares Goro will pass the test only if he can retire the opposing lineup in order, but Goro has come further than anyone imagined.

episodes.title: Distasteful Baseball
episodes.plot: The first-year scholarship team intentionally spots the Dream Island team a three-run lead. The insult fills Goro's team with renewed determination.

episodes.title: The Force of Scholarship Students
episodes.plot: Goro takes the mound, the team's expectations on his back, and gets back-to-back K's. As the Dream Island team is battling back, Mayumura shows up.

episodes.title: Goro vs Manual Baseball
episodes.plot: Toshiya hangs in against Akutsu by fouling off his knuckle balls. Shizuka kicks Akutsu off the team for focusing only on his competitive pride.

episodes.title: Together with You
episodes.plot: Down by one with two outs in the bottom of the 9th, Kokubu hits a home run to tie the game. With a walk-off win on the line, Mayumura takes the mound.

episodes.title: Kaidou's Secret
episodes.plot: Shizuka advises Goro to quit the team based on an incident from her past. When he learns what happened, he takes his appeal straight to the top.

episodes.title: Egashira's Expectations
episodes.plot: Chief Manager Egashira plots to make Goro into a Koshien star as a prop to boost Kaido's image. When Goro is told, his reaction stuns everyone.

episodes.title: Varsity Challenge
episodes.plot: In Goro's second year at Kaido, Momoko gives birth to a girl. With his send-off game against the first team at hand, Goro tells Shigeno his decision.

episodes.title: With My Own Two Feet
episodes.plot: In his send-off game, Goro is perfect through 6 innings, but starts losing speed on his fastball. In the 7th, he gives up a hit and gets into trouble.

episodes.title: Goodbye!
episodes.plot: Toshiya's home run ties the game, but in the 8th, the scholarship players refuse to take the field on defense, and the game takes an unexpected turn.

episodes.title: Goro's Dream and Daddy's Dream
episodes.plot: Five year old Goro practices baseball every day to be like his dad Shigeharu, a pro ballplayer,until he injures his elbow and decides to retire.

episodes.title: Their Friendship
episodes.plot: Goro invites a boy named Toshiya to play catch, reluctant at first, Toshiya comes to love it. Shigeharu vows to make a comeback as a hitter.

episodes.title: I Hate You, Daddy!
episodes.plot: A little league coach is dazzled by Goro's raw talent and teaches him to throw breaking balls. But Shigeharu, fearing injury, won't let him play.

episodes.title: A Birthday One Day Late
episodes.plot: Shigeharu is back on the team as a hitter and, on his best friend and teammate's suggestion, looks to remarry, but he's absent on Goro's birthday.

episodes.title: The Man From the Majors
episodes.plot: Goro is captivated by Joe Gibson, a major league player now playing in Japan. When Shigeharu homers off of him, Goro is beside himself with delight.

episodes.title: Goodbye...
episodes.plot: Shigeharu gets beaned by Gibson, but the Blue Oceans go on to win. Goro falls asleep enraptured, but the next day brings anything but joy.

episodes.title: Goro Honda, Age Nine!
episodes.plot: Three years after his father's death, Goro joins the Mifune little league team. The coach welcomes him warmly, but the team has no love for the game.

episodes.title: Team Complete!
episodes.plot: Kaoru Shimizu joins the Mifune team, but they're still two players short. Goro then runs into his classmate Komori, who's being forced to shoplift.

episodes.title: Alone on the Mound
episodes.plot: Komori and Sawamura join the Mifune Dolphins, who now have a full team, but they have to play a game to save the team despite having hardly practiced.

episodes.title: Showdown in the Rain
episodes.plot: Having learned the importance of teamwork, Goro steps up his game and puts down the adult batters, but his own team can't hit the opposing pitcher.

episodes.title: The Team Dad Played On
episodes.plot: The Mifune Dolphins have been reborn. Urged by Coach Ando, Goro goes to observe the top little league team in Japan and runs into his old pal Toshiya.

episodes.title: An Invitation From Gibson
episodes.plot: Gibson, now back in MLB, invites Goro to see him play in San Francisco. Though put off at first, Goro wants to see top-level baseball, so he accepts.

episodes.title: Summer! Baseball! Training Camp!
episodes.plot: The Mifune Dolphins join a training camp during summer break with all the best teams in Japan. Goro runs afoul of another team's heavy hitter.

episodes.title: Reckless Practice Match!
episodes.plot: After Mifune loses a practice game to Kuki Little in part because he can't bring himself to pitch inside, Goro asks Yokohama Little for a game.

episodes.title: The Coach's Feelings
episodes.plot: Goro, determined to beat Yokohama Little, helps Sawamura practice pitching. When Coach Ando sees them at it, he realizes he'd given up on his dreams.

episodes.title: I Quit!
episodes.plot: Ryoko, the girl Goro just met, is a pitcher for Yokohama Little. He invites her to play ping-pong, upsetting Shimizu and keeping her up all night.

episodes.title: Tournament Start!
episodes.plot: Before the fall tournament, Mifune practices at the batting cages. There, they run into the Okamura triplets, who play for their first-round opponent.

episodes.title: Aim for Victory!
episodes.plot: The Okamura triplets score a run off Goro with their strategy, and their ironclad defense grinds down Mifune's will, but Shimizu gives them new life.

episodes.title: Mother's Happiness
episodes.plot: In round two, Mifune faces Totsuka-Nishi Little, led by ace Kyuta Usami. Goro spots Momoko out with Shigeno and is consumed with dread.

episodes.title: Goro's Mistake!?
episodes.plot: Mifune is on the ropes; Goro suddenly gives up a home run, and they can't hit Kyuta's pitch. To make matters worse, Komori sprains his wrist.

episodes.title: This is Baseball!
episodes.plot: Sawamura's desperation bunt gets him on base, breaks up Kyuta's perfect game, and rattles the ace. Mifune then closes the gap to one run.

episodes.title: The Night Before the Match
episodes.plot: Mifune draws Yokohama Little in the quarters, but Komori's injury is worse than they thought. With the team needing a new catcher, Shimizu volunteers.

episodes.title: No Intention of Losing!
episodes.plot: Coach Ando throws out his back, so Momoko fills in for him against Yokohama Little. Mifune, overwhelmed by the big stage, commits several errors.

episodes.title: Chase It! Overcome It!
episodes.plot: Toshiya gets Goro to hit into a double play. In the top of the 3rd, as Goro gets shelled again, he uncorks his secret weapon on cleanup hitter Majima.

episodes.title: Everyone Together
episodes.plot: The game enters extra innings. Yokohama Little saps Goro's energy with bunts and puts Ryoko in to pitch. Goro's teammates worry about how he'll react.

episodes.title: Don't Say Goodbye
episodes.plot: Ryoko and Toshiya defy their coach and pitch to Goro. Ryoko puts all her might into her pitch, and Goro musters his last ounce of strength to swing.
